content.description: You can start with the chimney, the face or the crack system to a large ledge then to the top.
content.protection: Top Rope. No bolts/hangers. Sling or run cord around obvious tree at the top of the route

content.description: Follow a left leaning crack system up and left avoid the very large ledge. Once under the roof, stay left through a series of crimps to the top. Definitely an easy climb, with a much harder crux. Quality route though, a park favorite!
content.protection: A large tree serves as the top rope anchor
content.location: Center-right on the Rappel Rock. Descend from the picnic area down the steps. Follow the edge of the rock to the right, and you will see Ross Boulder on the left, and Rappel Rock's face on the right.

content.description: Begin at the right facing flake. Climb through the overhang and then climb to your left through the notch in the roof then traverse right and finish on at the top of the short face.
content.protection: Top Rope - Use a Back Rope

content.description: Start a few feet to the right of the ground directly under the overhang.  Climb up to the right side of the overhang.  Maneuver across the underside of the overhang and transition to ship’s prow.
content.protection: Used large trees on ships prow and rappel rock to set toprope anchor.  Must have at least 75 feet of anchor material.
content.location: Walk into the cave at the meeting point of Rappel Rock and Ship’s Prow.  The wall is on your right.

content.description: Located below the large triangular roof. Located left of Laid Back. Start at the flake on the left side of the large boulder below the main wall. Climb through the first bulge and move out left and pull through a thin move at the nose of the second bulge and continue up the large ledge. Move up and right through the final bulge to the top.
content.location: Left of the popular route Laid Back on the R.O.T.C. Wall. Look for the boulder in front of the main wall.

content.description:
Right of a left leaning crack, start between the face and a large boulder. 

  BAD LANDING
content.location: Rappel Rock - Walk down the entrance and at the bottom turn left.
